content.text: Add automated code quality checks to the CI pipeline to improve code standards and catch issues early.

fields.summary: Implement automated code quality checks in CI pipeline

content.text: Working on integrating the linting tools into the pipeline.
We will add style checking with prettier formatter.
This task is taking longer than anticipated due to:
Need to review and update configuration files across multiple repositories to ensure consistent linting rules.
package needs to be updated to support the new version.
Testing different configurations on feature branches is taking time to ensure optimal performance.
Note that this is a partial implementation of the quality checks
We are not using cached lint results yet.
If we continue with this approach as our primary quality check solution, we will need to revisit these points.
In addition to the previous updates, I have also made the following improvements:
Created dedicated configuration files for each project type to ensure appropriate linting rules are applied.
Optimized the linting process to run in parallel where possible, reducing overall CI execution time.
is not yet supported by all our plugins.
We previously checked plugin compatibility, but the required plugins don't support the new configuration format yet.
Successfully integrated the automated code quality checks into the CI pipeline.
As mentioned in previous comments, this implementation focuses on essential functionality and can be enhanced later if needed.

content.text: I'm trying to use the mock service in namespace dev-cluster, but the pod never becomes Ready,
so the service has no ready endpoints and cannot be accessed.
The mock service pods are stuck in Init:0/1. The main container never starts because the init container is waiting on dependencies.

fields.summary: Fix container initialization failure in development cluster
